attributes.comment:
I want to express my disapproval of the proposed increases for the forms
necessary in the process of international adoption. My husband and I started the
journey of international adoption in January 2006. At this point, we are going to
have to pay the fee a second time for the I-600A, because ours will be expiring
before we are able to go to China, the home of our future adoptive daughter. In
addition to that, we will have to get our fingerprints done again (as well as pay the
appropriate fees) before they "expire".

The process of international adoption is very costly and I am not in favor of any
increases that would make it even more difficult for my husband and I to continue
in this process, as well as discourage loving couples who are not physically able
to have biological children of their own from adopting a child or children that needs
a home and a hope.

Thank you for your time and I pray that you will take my opinion and thoughts into
consideration.

Sincerely,
Jennifer B. Danford

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jennifer B. Danford
